yenansun[at]uchicago[dot]edu} 		Hello, I'm a third-year PhD student in Linguistics at the University of Chicago. Before pursing PhD studies, I completed my BA in Chinese Language and Literature at Nanjing University.

  • Research interests
    semantics and its interface with syntax and pragmatics

  • Ongoing Projects
    • Focus particle ‘only’ in East Asian languages
    • Identity terms (e.g. same), equatives
      • Two strategies of samenss in Mandarin
      • The connection between same and equatives
    • Quantification and Referentiality
      • Mandarin mei with/without dou
      • Numerial yi ‘one’ as domain restrictor in Mandarin Chinese
      • The interaction between demonstratives and relative clauses in Mandarin
        •
    • Adjectives
      • A DM analysis of reduplication in Mandarin adjectives
      • The role of contextual-pragmatic information in speech perception
